page.title: 10TONMAWR - HOUSING
page.content: Most of the houses are stone built terraced houses, owner-occupied. The houses are addressed by the name of the row they are in: John Terrace, Abergwernffrwd Row, etc .The stone was quarried locally. Some of the houses, those built on a steep slope, have three storeys. A lot of householders have hidden the sandstone blocks under a layer of pebble-dashed cement. A small number of two storey council maisonettes have been built. A small number of semi-detatched dwellings have been built by their owners within the last few years. All this contrasts with Danycoed, further down the valley, which is entirely a council-housing estate.
